message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SY, cs.DS

The paper deals with the LPN problem, which is a fundamental problem in cryptography and falls under the category of "Cryptography and Security" (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the RING-LPN problem, which involves polynomials and their properties, making it relevant to "Information Theory" (cs.IT) and "Computational Complexity" (cs.CC). The algorithm presented in the paper is also applicable to solving problems in "Systems and Control" (cs.SY) and "Data Structures and Algorithms" (cs.DS).
